Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got 🔥

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of € 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
The Client

Our client is a digital hub company, founded by two of the largest companies in financial services and consultancy, with the goal of enabling innovation.

The result was a unique space where international corporates sit side-by-side and work together with cutting-edge startupsThe RoleFor one of their founding companies, they need a data analyst to be able to support on various fintech projects.

Data Analysis
Data visualisation

What they need

You are an experienced data analyst with 3+ years of experience
You have worked in banking or Fintech companies
You have experience with various data analyst tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Google analytics

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Immer in Bewegung, spontan und einfach anders: Berlin ist eine lebendige Stadt voller viefältiger Menschen und die Berliner Sparkasse seit mehr als 200 Jahren mitten drin. Wir sind der größte Finanzdienstleister in Berlin, eine Arbeitgeberin, die in der Region aktiv ist und Gutes tut – an dem Ort, wo du lebst und arbeitest. Hier triffst du ständig auf neue Leute, neue Themen, neue Herausforderungen. Ob im Geschäft mit Privat- und Firmenkunden/innen oder in der Immobilienfinanzierung sowie in den verschiedenen Bereichen der Berliner Sparkasse – hier bei uns kannst du deine Talente zeigen. Hier ist dein Job. So vielfältig wie du.

Aufgaben

In unserem Bereich Kunden- und Produktmanagement dreht sich alles um die Gestaltung innovativer Produkte und die Optimierung der Customer Journey. Dabei stehen die Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden im Mittelpunkt. Wir setzen auf agile Methoden, um flexibel und effektiv zu arbeiten.

Der Fokus Deiner Zukünftigen Tätigkeit


Du identifizierst und entwickelst anhand von Daten zielgerichtete Kommunikationsanlässe und stellst relevante Informationen zu unseren Kunden und Produkten bereit
Du entwickelst kreative Impulse für das Produktmanagement und unterstützt durch datengetriebene Insights die Marktforschung und das Vertriebscontrolling.
Du erstellst schnelle und präzise Ad-hoc-Analysen, um operative Fragestellungen zu klären und fundierte Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.
Du arbeitest aktiv in interdisziplinären Projekten mit und trägst dazu bei, unsere Prozesse und Angebote kontinuierlich zu verbessern.


Profil


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich mit starkem Fokus auf quantitative Methoden.
Du bringst Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse mit und bist versiert im Umgang mit großen Datensätzen.
Du hast fundierte IT-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Business Intelligence-Tools und -Anwendungen.
Du verfügst über fundiertes Wissen im Bankwesen und verstehst die relevanten Prozesse und Produkte.
Du besitzt ein ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen und arbeitest strukturiert und methodisch.
Du zeichnest dich durch hervorragende Problemlösungsfähigkeiten aus und setzt den Kunden stets in den Mittelpunkt deines Handelns.
Du bist ein echter Teamplayer, leistungsorientiert und übernimmst gerne Verantwortung.


Wir bieten

Ein spannender, abwechslungsreicher Job mit zahlreichen Entwicklungs- und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten, in einem wirtschaftlich stabilen Umfeld, in dem Arbeiten Spaß macht.


Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Mobiles Arbeiten für eine ausgezeichnete Work-Life-Balance sowie zusätzliche freie Tage (24.12. und 31.12.) - auch in Teilzeit.
Eine attraktive Vergütung – 13. Gehalt, Vermögenswirksame Leistungen und weitere Sozialleistungen.
Standortgarantie Berlin mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung.
Ein kostenloses Girokonto und weitere Produkte mit Vergünstigungen sowie Mitarbeiterangebote von starken Partnern.
Weitere Benefits: Betriebliche Altersversorgung, Work-Life-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts, Eltern-Kind-Büro, vielfältige Kunst-, Kultur- und Sportangebote sowie Essenszuschüsse.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Wir bieten

Ein spannender, abwechslungsreicher Job mit zahlreichen Entwicklungs- und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten, in einem wirtschaftlich stabilen Umfeld, in dem Arbeiten Spaß macht.

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Mobiles Arbeiten für eine ausgezeichnete Work-Life-Balance sowie zusätzliche freie Tage (24.12. und 31.12.) - auch in Teilzeit.
  • Eine attraktive Vergütung – 13. Gehalt, Vermögenswirksame Leistungen und weitere Sozialleistungen.
  • Standortgarantie Berlin mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung.
  • Ein kostenloses Girokonto und weitere Produkte mit Vergünstigungen sowie Mitarbeiterangebote von starken Partnern.
  • Weitere Benefits: Betriebliche Altersversorgung, Work-Life-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts, Eltern-Kind-Büro, vielfältige Kunst-, Kultur- und Sportangebote sowie Essenszuschüsse.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a low-code platform for workflow automation and AI app integration, designed for technical users. It simplifies connecting to any app or API and enables the incorporation of AI into business processes. n8n is Source Code Available and has a passionate and engaged community of builders!

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:

🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We're a diverse team of 60 talented people

🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing 5x year-over-year

⭐️ With +44k GitHub stars, we are in the top 0.0001% most popular projects on Github

🌱 We now count a total of $20m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured a Series A extension (February 2024)

MISSIONS

🎯 Your main goal will be to unlock insights that drive revenue growth and optimize sales & marketing efficiency at n8n.

To achieve this, you will:

1- Empower Marketing with actionable data insights

🔍 Transform complex marketing data into accessible insights by optimizing our BigQuery setup and integrating with tools like Metabase

📊 Analyze campaign performance, demographic trends, and product telemetry to help the marketing team focus on high-impact areas

🔗 Centralize and link additional data sources such as HockeyStack, Reo.dev, and Scarf to deepen our understanding of user behavior

2- Support RevOps and Sales with strategic analytics

📈 Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into sales performance and marketing ROI

🛠️ Run ad-hoc analyses to support sales strategies and inform RevOps decision-making

🧩 Develop attribution models to map out customer journeys and identify key conversion points

3- Optimize SEO and content strategies with data science

🔗 Leverage data science techniques to analyze node usage, SEO performance, and keyword strategies for maximum impact

🧠 Provide actionable recommendations to enhance our online presence and content marketing efforts

🚀 Explore new avenues for personalizing SEO strategies based on user interaction data

4- Proactively identify opportunities for growth

🌱 Continuously explore new data sources and methodologies to unlock further growth opportunities

🧩 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization

💡 Be a proactive voice at the table, driving conversations on how data can further our ambitious goals

5- Drive data-driven decision making across GTM

🎯 Lead efforts to ensure data-driven decision-making becomes a core part of our GTM culture, empowering team members with the insights they need.

📚 Maintain and expand our GTM data documentation, ensuring consistency and accessibility for current and future team members.

🛠️ Set up and manage the necessary tools, systems, and processes that streamline data access and analysis for GTM teams.

Requirements

Must-have

🛠️ 5+ years of relevant experience: You have a proven track record in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence, particularly in a marketing context.

💻 Advanced SQL proficiency: You are skilled in complex queries, including aggregations, joins, and filters, and can make data accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

🌐 Expertise with Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and BigQuery: You can handle data sources, manage transformations, and deliver actionable insights from complex datasets.

📊 Experience with revenue/sales CRM systems (especially Salesforce): You understand how to integrate CRM data with marketing analytics to drive sales and revenue growth.

🎯 Focus on business impact: You have a strong ability to translate data into strategic recommendations that directly contribute to revenue growth and operational efficiency.

⚙️ Pragmatic problem-solving skills: You are known for your bias for action and your ability to tackle complex challenges with practical solutions.

🔍 Proactive and curious mindset: You continuously seek out opportunities for analysis, always asking 'why' to uncover deeper insights.

📈 Experience in early-stage data teams: You've successfully set up tools, systems, and processes in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Nice-to-have

🔗 SEO and content marketing experience: You've worked with SEO datasets/tools and have a solid understanding of how to integrate these insights into broader marketing strategies.

📊 Data science/BI experience: You bring additional expertise in data science methodologies or business intelligence platforms, enhancing your ability to deliver sophisticated analyses.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.


Our company language is English


You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n.*

Benefits

💸 Competitive compensation

💪 Ownership: Our core value is to "empower others", and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity.

🏖️ Work/life balance: We work hard, but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday, plus public holidays wherever you are.

📈 Career growth: We are looking to hire 'rising stars', who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you €1k a year to spend on courses, books, events and coaching, to support you in developing your career.

🤩 A passionate team: We love our product, and we have regular office hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it!

🌏 Remote-first: Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment.

🙏 Transparency: We all know what everyone's working on, how's the company doing — the whole shebang.

🤝 Giving back: We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.

😍 Ambitious but kind culture where people love to work - our eNPS for 2023 is 100!

Disclaimer: If you see the same job posting in different locations, it's because we're hiring remotely and are pushing it to several locations! We're currently only making one RevOps hire. Please do not apply twice for the same position.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.
Show more
HTML:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
  • Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
  • Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
  • Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
  • Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
  • Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung


Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:

  • Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
  • Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
  • Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
  • Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
  • Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst


Was wir Dir bieten

  • ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
  • eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
  • Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
  • 28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
  • Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
  • Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
  • Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
  • Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
  • Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
  • Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
  • Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
  • Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club


Der Interview-Prozess

  • Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
  • Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
  • Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
  • Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung


Job Details

  • Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
  • Vollzeit
  • Arbeitsort: Berlin
  • Startdatum: ab sofort
  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell


Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team, you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.
Show more

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

  • Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
  • Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
  • Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
  • Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data

Nice to have:

  • Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
  • Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Analyst and Automation Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
SafeDriver Group GmbH is a leading company in the field of safe passenger transportation and an important service partner for innovative mobility companies and global players. With over 800 dedicated employees, we implement pioneering mobility solutions in Germany's urban centers. As a growing company, we are looking for an experienced and analytically strong personality to advance our group of companies as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/f/d).

Aufgaben


Performing data analysis and visualization with tools such as backends Google Cloud, AWS, Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Power BI.
Implementing machine learning models to predict business outcomes and optimize processes.
Analyzing large data sets to derive business trends and patterns.
Creating dashboards and reports to present insights to stakeholders.
stakeholders.
Collaborating with internal and external teams to implement data-driven projects.
Performing Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for data cleansing and preparation.
Development of statistical models and implementation of predictive models with Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and scikit-learn or similar.
Experience with ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load) and data pipelines an advantage.



Qualifikation


Degree in data science, information technology, business informatics or a related field (e.g. B.Sc. in Data Analytics, B.Sc. in International Economics & Management).
Practical experience in data analysis, data visualization and working with databases (SQL, NoSQL, Big Query).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Excel.
Experience with graph-based databases such as Neo4j or tools for processing unstructured data (e.g. Apache Kafka) is a plus.
Familiarity with machine learning and statistics (e.g. time series analysis, regression models).
Strong analytical thinking skills and ability to solve complex data problems.
Experience working with diverse stakeholders and the ability to make complex technical concepts understandable to non-technical teams.
Language skills: Fluent in English (C1), basic knowledge of German (B1 an advantage).



Benefits


A responsible position in a growing company with a lot of creative freedom.
A dynamic and challenging working environment with the opportunity to work on exciting projects.
The opportunity to actively shape strategic decisions and support the company on its growth path.
A dynamic and motivated team, as well as short decision-making paths.
Attractive remuneration and development opportunities.
Training opportunities and support for professional development.



We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
Location: Gigafactory Grunheide

Start date: October / November 2024

Duration: 6 months

Time type: Full time

Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together.

What You'll Do


Identifying trends and generate insights by conducting analyses of Tesla´s data systems
Convey crucial findings with internal stakeholders to encourage data-driven storytelling and decision-making
Identify critical metrics and develop high-level dashboards to monitor the advancement of the company's KPIs and its top objectives
Constantly pursue methods to increase operational effectiveness
Engage in internal stakeholder meetings and present status updates on a weekly basis
Create reports and keep track of project performance using spreadsheets and data metrics
Support the Program Manager to collect data from cross functional teams



What You'll Bring


Studying towards a degree in Data Science, Supply Chain Management, Purchasing or Economics
Experience with data analytics and visualization programs like Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Excellent analytical skills including advanced Excel (ie. macros, VBA), SQL and Python preferred
Preferable previous experience in Supply chain processes and procurement



, Tesla

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, you’ll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. You’ll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What You’ll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What We’re Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst VI (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place – from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.




Your role

Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role




Your profile

BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English




We offer

Remote Work: Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility: Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team: We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future: You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay: For your remote job you’ll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding: Your team members Lucas and Rémy will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning. Here you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year: Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing: Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.




Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you. Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.

Title: Game Data Analyst (World of Warships)
Description:
Job Overview

Wargaming is looking for a Game Data Analyst to work on World of Warships , World of Warships: Legends and World of Warships: Blitz in our brand to strengthen the World of Warships product analytics team.

You will be a part of the team working on analyzing, visualizing, monitoring and managing data of three World of Warships Franchise games. We cover all kinds of products' needs ranging from in-game battle analysis to game economy and financial monitoring. We work extensively with game production team for both providing sufficient data for informed decisions and to enhance data processes within the development.

Reports to

Our future colleague will report to BI Team Lead

What will you do?


Work closely with internal customers and stakeholders to elicit business requirements and transform them into valuable BI reports / research reports for senior management and product teams all over the globe;
Identify the key needs and point of growth of the development team and identify which data and how can enhance the decision-making process;
Define the format and to provide the decision support outputs (dashboards, ad hoc reports);
Determine key measurement metrics for new functionality and define tracking strategy;
Consult users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues, if necessary;
Directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using various system reporting tools, if necessary.


What are we looking for?


3+ year experience on similar position;
Experience in game development (2+ years) and understanding of game production processes and needs;
Advanced knowledge of SQL at the level of complex queries;
Data visualization skills, proficiency with BI instruments (we use Tableau);
Good mathematical knowledge and knowledge of statistics;
Knowledge of Python popular libraries for data processing and analysis;
Experienced in working with DWH, overall understanding of DWH design and operations;
Written and spoken English (B2 and higher).


What additional skills will help you stand out?


Experience in ETL processes design and implementation, data lifecycle management.
Experience with math or simulation modeling.


Work mode

Hybrid (2-3 days of work from the office)

Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Belgrade include:


Additional Vacation days on top of the statutory minimum dependent on years of service with Wargaming Group
Up to 8 "Trust days" per calendar year that require no medical certificate
Career development and education opportunities within the company
English clubs and platform for learning languages
Premium Private Health Care
Mental well-being program (iFeel)
Commuting allowance
Gym trainings / Wellness program
Personal Gaming Account
Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
Company events
Seniority Awards
Referral program - you can recommend the best talents to the Company and receive a reward


Please submit your CV in English to ensure smooth processing and review.

About Wargaming

Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Operating since 1998, Wargaming has become one of the leaders in the gaming industry with 15 offices worldwide, including studios in Chicago, Prague, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Vilnius. Our diverse and multicultural team works together to deliver a top-class experience to millions of players who enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms. Our flagship products include free-to-play hits World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Tanks Blitz.

Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Apply Online Today!




=

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
CHEEX is an online platform for sexual entertainment and education. We create a progressive and inclusive

approach to pornography, where people of all sexual orientations and identities can enjoy content that is

inspiring, explanatory and helps with the individual path to sexual liberation. As a Senior Data Analyst, you

will play a key role in supporting our teams with data insights, helping us enhance our data-driven strategy

and contribute to the ongoing revolution in SexTech. Join us in shaping a future where sexuality is explored

freely, inclusively, and responsibly.




What you'll do

You’ll conduct exploratory data analysis, identify trends and patterns.
You’ll create impactful visualizations that present complex datasets in an understandable way.
You’ll support the development and implementation of data pipelines, ETL processes, and data models to ensure seamless data integration and processing.
You’ll perform detailed assessments of company data quality.
You’ll identify opportunities for improvement.
You’ll collaborate with an interdisciplinary team to successfully implement business intelligence projects.




Requirements

You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst, with exposure to Data Engineering, ideally within a subscription-based business environment.
You have a strong command of SQL, data modeling, ETL processes, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio). Experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS and Google Cloud, is a plus.
You're fluent in both German and English and can effectively communicate insights and recommendations to diverse audiences.
You're proactive, collaborative, and contribute actively to teamwork and cross-functional efforts
You like to join our team in our beautiful office at least 2 times a week.




Our Offer

An international team with people with different backgrounds
The will and the possibilities to get yourself involved and make a difference
Flexible working hours - you decide when it’s your best time to work
Mobile work policy - you’re able to work up to 2,5 months a year from everywhere of the EEA
Beautiful office located in the heart of Kreuzberg - easy to reach and also lots of good food
BVG Deutschland Ticket - we want you to get around easily
Dog friendly office - we love furry friends
Regular team activities like lunches, offsites or other events to bond with your colleagues




At CHEEX, everything we do is guided by our main values:




Sex-Positivity: We promote an open, tolerant and progressive attitude towards sexuality, free from any shame, or judgement. All consensual sexual activities are healthy and pleasurable. We do not discriminate among types of preferences, as these are individual and personal.
Empowerment: We believe everyone should be given the opportunity to live and work in a selfdetermined way. We empower both our community, as well as our team to make autonomous decisions, and thus enable them to unlock their full potential and confidence.
Transparency: We are not afraid to be open and honest. About our industry, about the way we work, how we feel, how others make us feel, what we stand for and what we reject. We are transparent in the way we communicate mistakes and we embrace the fact that we will never stop learning.




We are particularly happy to receive applications from sex workers, people of color, people from the LGBTQIA+ community, people from immigrant families, as well as people with disabilities. Since your skills and qualifications are important to us and not your appearance, we ask you not to send a photo with your application. Thank you!

Show more
HTML:
CHEEX is an online platform for sexual entertainment and education. We create a progressive and inclusive

approach to pornography, where people of all sexual orientations and identities can enjoy content that is

inspiring, explanatory and helps with the individual path to sexual liberation. As a Senior Data Analyst, you

will play a key role in supporting our teams with data insights, helping us enhance our data-driven strategy

and contribute to the ongoing revolution in SexTech. Join us in shaping a future where sexuality is explored

freely, inclusively, and responsibly.


What you'll do

  • You’ll conduct exploratory data analysis, identify trends and patterns.
  • You’ll create impactful visualizations that present complex datasets in an understandable way.
  • You’ll support the development and implementation of data pipelines, ETL processes, and data models to ensure seamless data integration and processing.
  • You’ll perform detailed assessments of company data quality.
  • You’ll identify opportunities for improvement.
  • You’ll collaborate with an interdisciplinary team to successfully implement business intelligence projects.


Requirements

  • You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst, with exposure to Data Engineering, ideally within a subscription-based business environment.
  • You have a strong command of SQL, data modeling, ETL processes, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio). Experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS and Google Cloud, is a plus.
  • You're fluent in both German and English and can effectively communicate insights and recommendations to diverse audiences.
  • You're proactive, collaborative, and contribute actively to teamwork and cross-functional efforts
  • You like to join our team in our beautiful office at least 2 times a week.


Our Offer

  • An international team with people with different backgrounds
  • The will and the possibilities to get yourself involved and make a difference
  • Flexible working hours - you decide when it’s your best time to work
  • Mobile work policy - you’re able to work up to 2,5 months a year from everywhere of the EEA
  • Beautiful office located in the heart of Kreuzberg - easy to reach and also lots of good food
  • BVG Deutschland Ticket - we want you to get around easily
  • Dog friendly office - we love furry friends
  • Regular team activities like lunches, offsites or other events to bond with your colleagues


At CHEEX, everything we do is guided by our main values:


  • Sex-Positivity: We promote an open, tolerant and progressive attitude towards sexuality, free from any shame, or judgement. All consensual sexual activities are healthy and pleasurable. We do not discriminate among types of preferences, as these are individual and personal.
  • Empowerment: We believe everyone should be given the opportunity to live and work in a selfdetermined way. We empower both our community, as well as our team to make autonomous decisions, and thus enable them to unlock their full potential and confidence.
  • Transparency: We are not afraid to be open and honest. About our industry, about the way we work, how we feel, how others make us feel, what we stand for and what we reject. We are transparent in the way we communicate mistakes and we embrace the fact that we will never stop learning.


We are particularly happy to receive applications from sex workers, people of color, people from the LGBTQIA+ community, people from immigrant families, as well as people with disabilities. Since your skills and qualifications are important to us and not your appearance, we ask you not to send a photo with your application. Thank you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We’re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Data Analyst- 12 Months Fixed Term (f/m/d)
Description:
Why Scout24?

Scout24 is home of ImmoScout24, Germany’s #1 for real estate. With ImmoScout24 we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in Germany and Austria for more than 25 years. Our goal is to build a digital ecosystem that brings homeowners, seekers, and agents together. Finding the right home and property is one of the most important decisions in life. So is your career! #WorkingatScout24 means being part of a diverse and inclusive team of 1,060 colleagues and 58 nationalities. We embrace difference and celebrate individuality. By encouraging open mindedness and authenticity we enable a true learning culture and prepare the ground for personal development. Mistakes are a chance to grow and to innovate. Together we act proactively, strive for improvement, and take responsibility. We talk about success and challenge while treating each other with respect because we are #oneteam.

If this sounds interesting to you, we would love to see you joining us! Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the job requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. Grow with us!. Welcome home!

Aside from our people and company culture we are offering awesome benefits that make Scout24 a great place to work!


Compensation: A competitive salary package and a bonus on top.
Flexibility: Decide for yourself where you work most effectively. We offer you a hybrid working model, autonomous working time management and 30 days of vacation annually.
Work from abroad: Our remote working policy includes the possibility to work from abroad for a few weeks per year (if it gets along with the business and team needs)
Relocation: Our relocation agency supports you with your visa process and an attractive relocation package.
Use our products: As an employee you can take advantage of our plus membership for tenants on ImmoScout24 to find a new place to live.
Development: Dedicated learning time per month, online courses on our ScoutAcademy, regular book challenges, structured feedback, “Lunch & Learn”-Events and individual career paths to push your career to the next level.   
Have kids? We'll support you with a professional family service, which helps you to find a childcare center or offers emergency childcare.  
Furry feel good manager: Bring your dog to work (upon approval, as we prioritise the well-being of our employees and ensure that our dog policy is considerate of allergic individuals and prevents overcrowding on each office floor).
Mobility: We subsidize public transport or Job Bikes.
Commitment to sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): We have clear environmental and climate protection goals and are involved in social activities and charitable organizations throughout the year. We live the diversity. Our theme weeks on diversity, mental well-being, and other social issues give us time and space to develop ourselves on DEI and sustainability.
Pension scheme: We offer a company pension scheme and support your own contribution with an attractive subsidy.
Most innovative office: Our office is barrier-free and in the heart of Berlin right at the central station. It was awarded for the most innovative office concept. We have an own gym with regular courses, napping room, rooftop terrace, organic coffee, cafeteria, 100% green electricity and a massage therapist that comes in once a week.
Health: Life Situation Coaching, regular health check ups
We are a tech company: We work with the latest technical tools and hardware. 


How Your Role Will Look Like


Serve as the subject matter expert on app analytics within a larger team of analysts, product managers, designers and software engineers
Collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
Build metrics around user journeys (e.g. customer lifetime value) and provide insights about cohorts like registered / non-registered users
Design data models, reports and visualizations by using technologies like Google Analytics/BigQuery, SQL and BI-Tools (e.g. MicroStrategy)
Contribute to a valuable, robust, and high-performing app analytics environment by optimizing code, debugging anomalies, and creating documentation
Provide training and support to team members on app analytics methodologies, tools, and best practices  


What You Need To Succeed


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analytics setting with mobile apps, preferably in a similar industry
Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus
Strong proficiency in English language, German is a plus


We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.
Show more

  • Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
  • Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
  • Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
  • Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
  • Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus

We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.

Title: Fully Remote : Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English & German speaking Online Data Analyst's for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany.
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Willingness to learn and adapt to changing guidelines and tasks







Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.







Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary well-being package, encompassing a wealth of well-being resources
Be part of an online community







Payment

Rate of pay per task is inclusive of reading task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms of the contributor agreement upon successful completion of tasks.







What’s next?

If this sounds like a role you’d be interested in taking on, please apply below.

https://jobs.telusinternational.com/en_US/careers/PipelineDetail/Online-Data-Quality-Analyst-m-f-d-Germany/21405







Important notice: TELUS International will never request a monetary deposit for any role or project with the company, and our recruitment and sourcing teams only use @telusinternational.com or @telusinternational.ai addresses when emailing candidates. If you are unsure as to whether a job offer is legitimate, please contact us at TI_AICommunitySupport@telusinternational.com for confirmation.
