Recognized by Forbes as one of the top 100 private cloud companies and acknowledged by Waterstone Human Capital as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, PointClickCare leads the way in creating cloud-based healthcare software.

At PointClickCare, we offer a wealth of opportunities and a vibrant culture that empowers our employees. Our dynamic environment is the perfect place to advance your career while engaging in meaningful work alongside incredible colleagues. Here, you’ll discover a space where your talents can thrive, your career can grow, and your work will have a lasting impact on healthcare across North America. We believe that work becomes profoundly fulfilling when driven by a higher purpose.

Join us and be part of a team that is making a real impact.

To learn more about us, check out Life at PointClickCare and connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.

Position Summary

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Governance & Quality, the Data Governance Analyst is responsible for assisting to develop, implement, and evaluate a data governance framework that applies to the entire organization. This position will work with SMEs across all business domains within PointClickCare to understand and address data quality issues and help expand the data stewardship network to achieve data quality and governance goals.

The Data Governance Analyst will improve the integrity, discoverability, and accessibility of shared data assets by leading the integration and enterprise-wide use of Data Governance Tools and Technologies to improve data value creation across the enterprise. This position brings value through the insights and recommendations from data analyses and collaboration with the business to enhance data quality, improve data practices, and enable strategic decision-making.

As we demonstrate value from data, we are looking for passionate, experienced, and curious people like you to join our important journey to advocate for data quality initiatives and evangelize the data excellence culture.

This position supports the expansion of the growing emphasis on data quality and data governance in a highly data-driven organization. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada or the U.S. The ideal candidate brings seasoned experience in data quality practices, data governance and cross-functional business-facing projects.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Provide the Corporate Data Office team with data analysis from researching systems and processes, profiling data via SQL queries, and validating data quality requirements.
  • Develop workflows within Erwin Data Intelligence/Data Quality Suite
  • Develop integrations between Erwin Data Intelligence/Data Quality and other metadata and lineage tools (Purview, Manta, etc)
  • Design and build comprehensive Data Quality Solution for the data residing in the Azure cloud
  • Support data governance and data quality initiatives by developing and implementing data quality dashboards, rules, communication, and adoption.
  • Coordinate with various stakeholders and leaders across business functions to operationalize the Data Governance Framework (training and education, developing data stewardship, data custodian roles, data dictionary, definitions and documentation, approval, and sign-off protocols).
  • Support data quality management and data quality issue prioritization.
  • Contribute to the ongoing maintenance of data governance and data quality policies, processes, and documentation.
  • Support corporate data quality initiatives through recommendation for solutions and leadership around data validation.
  • Analyze and understand corporate data across data domains, on both source and target levels.
  • Collaborate with other data analysts from cross-functional teams to address data quality issues and educate data stewardship on data governance principles.
  • Develop excellent rapport and communication skills with business partners, cross-functional leaders, developers/engineers, data analysts, as well as the management team. Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction.
  • Identify new opportunities for data governance continually.

Skills And Experience

  • Have a post-secondary degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Healthcare Informatics, or a related discipline.
  • 3-5 years experience in a Data Governance role, preferably within a large organization.
  • Possess a strong understanding of data governance principles, best practices, and industry standards.
  • Have experience in developing and implementing data governance policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Proficient in data management tools and technologies, including data cataloging, data quality, metadata management (Erwin DI/DQ preferred)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify data governance issues and propose effective solutions.
  • Experience working with relational databases, particularly utilizing SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Experience with CRM tools such as SalesForce and NetSuite will be considered a strong asset.
  • Have hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as PowerBI.
  • Possess the ability to work independently, effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.

It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.

When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team: recruitment@pointclickcare.com

PointClickCare is committed to Information Security. By applying to this position, if hired, you commit to following our information security policies and procedures and making every effort to secure confidential and/or sensitive information.

At PointClickCare, base salary is one of the many components that make up our total rewards package. The US base salary range for this position is $80,000 - 90,000 + bonus or commission + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by job and level. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual compensation is determined by job-related skills and knowledge, relevant experience including professional and lived experience, and/or work location. Your recruiter can share more information about our total rewards package during the hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Hybrid 3 days a week

Description

The person will be on the new Operational & Business Metrics team within an IT Management/COO organization. The team defines and produces metrics focusing on key initiatives in our space, operational effectiveness and business management. The team works horizontally across many silos. The person will be in a business & data analytics role, working on a team of three (or four depending when they join).




Responsibilities:

Display strong analytical skills, with a proven track record of managing & reporting on large datasets.
You will engage in the entire data life cycle - collect requirements, identify or build data source, analyze data, build data pipelines to load and transform data, visualize and present data.
Ensure data quality, manage and scale data solutions.
Implementing appropriate industry-standard practices, including defining and reporting on key metrics, identifying risks, issues, gaps, and dependencies within and across work streams.
Assistance with documenting data models and flows, artifacts, and responsibilities.
Develop, analyze, and present findings in response to senior management requests.
Demonstrate good time management and ability to prioritize tasks and to meet deadlines across multiple projects.
Must be flexible, highly adaptable to a constantly changing environment. The candidate will be asked to juggle multiple ad hoc requests in addition to the BAU aspects of the role.

The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated and flexible team player who has a strategic vision but also the ability to execute successfully.




Requirements:

Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience working with data analytics / visualization software. Power BI preferred.
Background in statistics or data science is a plus.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills (Verbal and Written).
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to analyze / synthesize large amounts of information and present findings to senior audiences.
Ability to work across functional disciplines and with all levels of the organization.
Ability to work independently in a high-pressure environment while juggling multiple tasks.
Ability to be flexible with ever-changing prioritization.
Creative thinker who will take complete ownership and accountability.
Background in statistics or data science is a plus.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2013, Organigram first began as a medical cannabis provider. Today, the Company is focused on winning in the Canadian recreational market and dynamically expanding the company’s global footprint and influence.

Organigram has developed a portfolio of adult-use recreational cannabis brands including Edison, Big Bag o’ Buds, SHRED, Monjour, Holy Mountain and Trailblazer. Quebec’s top-selling hash brand Tremblant Cannabis, and artisanal craft brand, Laurentian are also additions to Organigram’s brand portfolio. Organigram operates facilities in three provinces across the country. The primary indoor growing facility is in Moncton, New Brunswick, the premium hash production and premium cultivation facility is in Lac-Supérieur, Quebec and there is a highly automated facility dedicated to edibles manufacturing in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The Company is regulated by Health Canada under the Cannabis Act (Canada) and the Cannabis Regulations (Canada).

Organigram is focused on translating operational excellence into strong financial results and return on investment for shareholders.

Job Summary

As a Commercial Analyst based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making processes. You’ll collaborate closely with the Commercial and IT teams to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights that optimize our recreational cannabis commercial strategies. Your work will directly inform sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain decisions, helping to drive growth and efficiency across the company.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, is eager to develop their skills in a dynamic environment and is excited about making a tangible impact on one of Canada’s leading licensed producer.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze commercial performance data to support decision-making across sales, marketing, commercialization and supply chain teams.
Develop and enhance Power BI dashboards and other analytical tools, transforming data into clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, maintain, and transform data from multiple internal and external sources for analysis.
Create and maintain data models to ensure accurate reporting and forecasting.
Translate business questions into analytical projects and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and solve specific business challenges.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all analysis and reporting.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve data analytics processes and tools in collaboration with IT and business teams.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid 1-3x/week on site)
Contract Duration: 08 months (with possible extension)
Schedule Hours: 9 am-5 pm Monday-Friday (No OT)
 
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst and/ or Data Analyst focusing on technical projects.
2 years of experience working with data analysis techniques and tools, such as SQL, Excel, PowerBI and Tableau.
Demonstrated knowledge of one or more key information service standards such as SDLC, ITIL, Six Sigma, etc.
Experience with requirements management tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile, Scrum (preferably) or Waterfall.
Nice-To-Have Skills:
Experience in Google Cloud Platform
Bilingual: English and Spanish
Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis ) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.
Typical Day in Role:
Analyzes performance of process activities, identifies problem areas, and presents findings in clear, concise charts, graphs, tables, or summaries.
Work with key stakeholders and gather requirements.
Establishes standardized methods of recording, tracking and reporting on activity.
Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes.
Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
Best vs. Average Candidate:
The best candidate is someone with experience as BA and DA, speaks Spanish, and has a certificate in IIBA.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or a related field required
Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Angular Directions are working closely with a unique company based out of Canada who are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to drive their operation in Ottawa. With a dedication to Ecomm Optimisation, Risk Management, and Data Analysis, this company is a proud client of ours and we're delighted to help them find the ideal BI Analyst with strong foundations in SQL and Tableau and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. Join their dynamic team and help them drive business intelligence initiatives forward.




We are opening our new office in Ottawa in the coming weeks and so any successful applicant will be working 3 or 4 days per week on-site in Ottawa.




We have created an overview of the role and the needs for the role below:




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and analyze data from various sources.
Design, build, and deploy Tableau reports and dashboards to provide insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with multiple stakeholder groups to understand their business requirements
Support the continuous improvement of data quality and reporting processes.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Tableau for data visualization and dashboard creation and wider Tableau proficiency, as well as SQL knowledge.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Previously worked with agile project management tools eg. Jira , Trello would be a bonus.
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.







What We Offer:

Competitive salary and paid health insurance.
RRSP group benefits savings plan
Hybrid work schedule
Training and tuition reimbursement
New equipment / handwear with up-to-date applications
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Allowance for monthly commute/ parking
Team building activities
A collaborative and innovative work environment.




We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Canadian reinsurance company and help us empower and advance our mutual insurance community!




We have an excellent opportunity to join one of Waterloo Region’s top employers as a Data Analyst in our Innovation department. With this position, you will have the opportunity to join a culture that takes pride in being honest, delivering on promises and is committed to doing what is right.




This position offers a hybrid work schedule.




The Role:

The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining current dashboards and assisting the development of new dashboards, charts, and visual aids to analyze data and enable decision making. This includes data profiling and analysis, data cleansing and quality review, and the development of ETL packages for Data transformation, where required. In this role, the data analyst will work on a small team alongside a data engineer, digital architect, and senior data analyst to build new Data & Insights capabilities at Farm Mutual Re.




The successful candidate can expect to:

Assist in preparing and delivering current annual, semi-annual, quarterly, and monthly reports for internal and external partners
Maintain and update data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision making
Analyze data to answer key questions from business partners, growing and building an understanding of what drives business performance
Assist with the design, development and monitoring of data pipelines, transformations and/or data modelling, including constructing ETL packages for Data Transformation and Integration between different applications
Support the creation of templates and documentation, including a data dictionary and data catalogue, and other templates as required to build new Data & Insights capabilities




Your Skills and Qualifications:

You have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst experience with a foundation in data modelling & analytics
Experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik, PowerBI and Tableau
Some experience with data languages such as SQL, Python, R and Excel
Analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, analyze, and present datasets
Have an understanding of SDLC and Agile Frameworks
Proven data analytic skills, including data mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization




Join Our Team!

Recognized as one of Waterloo Area’s Top Employers 2024 as well as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers 2024, at Farm Mutual Re we are committed to inclusion for all and cultivating belonging where everyone can be their authentic and best selves.




Operating since 1959, Farm Mutual Re is a general reinsurer, sharing in the property, automobile, liability, and other risks originally accepted by insurance companies operating principally in Canada.

We’re passionate about empowering and supporting our employees and business partners. Our relationships are the foundation that helps us advance the mutual insurance community. We take pride in giving back to our community and the environment. We hold ourselves accountable for the promises we make to our members, employees, and valued business partners.




Our office is in Cambridge, Ontario off the 401 in a state-of-the-art, environmentally friendly building. Our employees enjoy perks including complimentary access to an on-site gym, a variety of fitness classes and wellness sessions, as well as the flexibility to work remotely as we embrace the modern hybrid work environment. Our culture is supportive of achieving a balanced and healthy lifestyle. In addition to a great working environment, we invest in our employees continued professional development, offer a competitive salary, employer-paid benefits, pension plan and more.




How to Apply:

Don’t miss this opportunity to join our team. Visit our website and complete our Employment Application found on our Careers page.




In accordance with our company values, Farm Mutual Re is committed to creating an equitable, diverse, and inclusive work environment for all as well as to providing accommodations and achieving a barrier-free workplace. Should you require an accommodation to participate in our recruitment process, please contact recruitment@farmmutualre.com.

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting
Description:
Join Hotspex Media!

🙌 #1 Ranked Media Buying and Planning Agency on Clutch.co

🔥 Finalist 'Best AI Tool', 2024 Digiday Technology Awards

🎉 Deloitte Fast 500

Job Summary

Hotspex Media Agency seeks an experienced Data Analyst specializing in web analytics reporting to join our innovative team. This role requires a seasoned professional with over 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, particularly with GA4 and Adobe Analytics. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our data-driven decision-making processes, spearheading the creation and maintenance of insightful reports that support our clients' marketing strategies.

Job Responsibilities


Spearhead the creation and maintenance of comprehensive analytics reports using GA4 and Adobe Analytics to support various digital marketing campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics, performance indicators, and develop custom reporting solutions.
Conduct advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights and strategic recommendations for campaign optimization.
Design and implement automated reporting processes to streamline data collection and presentation across multiple analytics platforms.
Perform regular audits of reporting methodologies to ensure accuracy, consistency, and alignment with evolving analytics best practices.
Mentor junior team members on analytics tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Present data insights and recommendations to internal teams and clients, translating complex analytics into actionable business strategies.


Required Skills


Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, with proficiency in both GA4 and Adobe Analytics.
Advanced knowledge of digital marketing concepts, web analytics, and data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.
Expertise in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or PowerBI.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BigQuery for advanced data analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience managing multiple projects and prioritizing effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated ability to stay current with evolving analytics technologies and methodologies.


Our Values:

We know our people are what allows us to achieve all that we do and that’s why it’s important that everyone we bring onto our team lives our values with us.

💪 Resilience
🚀 Empowerment

Title: Data Analyst - GCP
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

•Hands on and at good years work experience working with Google Cloud Services like Big Query, Dataflow, Data Proc, Cloud Functions, Cloud Data Fusion, Cloud Composer etc.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design

•Developing data ingestion framework for different sources

•Strong migration experience of Hadoop cluster to Google Cloud

•Ability to suggest optimal architectural solution on GCP to customer

•Strong knowledge in SQL, Java\Python

•Certified as Professional Data Engineer - GCP.

•Good Communication skill.

•Exposure to Hadoop ecosystem

•Prior working experience as Data Analyst or similar project.

•GCP knowledge and tools like Tableau / BI / Looker will be addition to this Role.

•Managing Data Analyst role, Compare data and match against the requirement.

•Analyzing various source of data and compare with target data.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LeverageTek is actively seeking a Data Specialist for a 3-month contract with its Ottawa-based customer.




Work Location

Remote




Key Tasks

Liaise with internal Technology project teams and stakeholders to enable and ensure adherence to data standards, data quality, data planning, data governance, data security
Provide leadership to project teams and stakeholders to ensure an understanding of the organization's data policies, data quality standards, data governance, data processes
With project teams and stakeholders, identify project data needs, data risks
Conduct data profiling and assessment based on data quality rules
Conduct analysis of data to ensure compliance with standards and governance
Conduct data profiling, identify and develop metadata and data models
Provide knowledge transfer to project teams and stakeholders regarding best practices and adherence to the organizations’ data governance and quality standards
Provide ongoing reporting to the organization’s Data and Information Management team regarding project data status, attending regular meetings as required




Key Qualifications

6+ years experience specializing in data planning, data analysis, data quality, data governance, data security, data risk management
Strong expertise in Data Management and Data Governance
Experience in data profiling, data modeling, metadata, data processes




Key Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or in a related field
Experience providing hands-on knowledge transfer to project teams
Strong team collaboration and leadership skills
Excellent communication skills (writing/verbal)
Experience writing and presenting reports to key stakeholders
Passion, diligence, analytical, detail-oriented
Experience with Agile principles and the Scrum Framework




Assets

Experience with the use of data modeling tools (Erwin, Collibra or other)
Experience with Data Quality tools




About LeverageTek IT Solutions

Thank you for taking the time to apply! Since our company’s inception in March 2003, LeverageTek IT Solutions has worked resolutely to become one of the industry’s most recognized and trusted suppliers of technology staffing and business consulting services. With hundreds of successful engagements to our credit with many of Canada’s leading public and private sector organizations, we are the experts in identifying, deploying, and supporting IT and business talent on a contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent basis. We work with customers across all sectors including academia, aerospace, aviation, finance, government, health care, high tech, military, not-for-profit, and more.

Our responsive service and ability to deliver the right fit, on time and within budget, typically leads to repeat engagements and a long-standing relationship.

Accessibility accommodations are available upon request.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your Knowledge of Power BI and Data Analysis

To our Information Technology Team




CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data Analyst who will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting financial data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and operational initiatives. As part of our Enterprise Architecture team, you will work closely with other cross-functional departments including IT, Finance and Operations, collaborating with business stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations. As a Data Analyst you will be accountable for understanding data needs, working to design and develop reports and dashboards, and conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Working collaboratively with business stakeholders within IT, Business Intelligence and Finance departments and other operational teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.




Extracting, cleaning, and manipulating large datasets from multiple sources including financial databases, CRM systems, ERP systems, and spreadsheets.




Performing analysis of data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.




Designing and developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to present findings in a clear and concise manner.




Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.




Conducting variance analysis and performance reporting to support budgeting and forecasting processes.




Assisting in the design and implementation of data collection systems and strategies to optimize efficiency and data quality.




Administering, monitoring, supporting and maintaining SQL servers in our environment.




Staying current in industry trends and best practices in data analysis and modeling.




Who You Are:

A post-secondary graduate preferably in information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field.




Experienced in working with databases and ERP systems with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Data Analyst role.




Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel and data processing tools and software – in particular Power BI.




Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint. Experience with Salesforce or other CRM considered an asset.




Highly organized and able to manage projects and timelines within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Able to work efficiently and effectively as a team member, as well as independently.




An excellent communicator with the ability to convey ideas succinctly and conveying complex findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders with ease.




A self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically about solutions.




Committed to ongoing training and a desire to learn new skills and continually expand upon knowledge and expertise.




What We Offer:

A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what’s next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.




Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.




Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.




Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.




Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we’re committed to your well-being.




Who We Are:

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.




We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.




CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with “Accommodation Required” in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a fast-growing producer of spirit-based beverages is seeking a data analyst. This candidate will work with the executive team, regional management and sales representatives across Canada preparing detailed analysis of sales, inventory data and other reports as required.

The primary focus of this position is collecting, inputting, and analyzing large volumes of data from various provincial sources, finalizing and distributing reports. This position requires expert level excel skills, data management skills and basic accounting knowledge.

Analysts with previous consumer packaged goods experience or alcohol industry experience are especially sought after for this role.

Responsibilities

Input/Analyze data from multiple sources to complete standardized weekly and monthly sales reports.
Utilize territory sales data and geographic mapping to identify opportunities for sales growth.
Ensure checks and balances across all weekly, bi-weekly and monthly reports for sales data and accounting purposes.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.

Qualifications & Skill set

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or Mathematics.
5 years experience in an analytics role, prior experience in the alcohol industry is preferred.
Expert level skill in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Access.
Experience analyzing large amounts of confidential data.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
Critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong verbal and written communication.

Compensation/Benefits

Attractive compensation package.
Comprehensive benefit package.
Bonus opportunity.
3 weeks vacation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our clients team located in Edmonton, Alberta. The role involves working closely with a cross-functional team in the financial industry, specifically focusing on ETL processes. This Data Analyst contract opportunity is offered with an initial term of 4-months with potential to extend.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement ETL processes to extract data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and flat files
Apply data cleaning, transformation, and enrichment techniques to prepare data for analysis and reporting
Load transformed data into data warehouses, data lakes, or other storage solutions to ensure accessibility and usability
Employ SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SAS and other tools/technologies for data analysis, reporting, performance optimization, and database management
Constantly update knowledge on industry best practices and emerging technologies to provide continuous improvement
Work with a cross-functional team to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Solve complex problems using data-driven techniques
Document all processes, methodologies, and procedures in a clear and concise manner
Handle customer inquiries and provide high quality customer service
Monitor customer accounts and take appropriate action as needed


Requirements


Proven experience with SQL and SAS
Demonstrated understanding and application of Business Logic
Proficient in Database management and Database Object handling
Knowledge in AB Testing
Expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to create and manage Business Requirement Documents
Strong focus on maintaining Data Quality
Experience in Data Warehousing
Familiarity with ETL - Extract Transform Load processes

Title: Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

• Good years of experience in Data Analyst/Data Engineer.

•Experience in data visualization, data cleaning, data manipulation (extract, transform, load), and tool usage of Tableau, Talend, SSIS.

•Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

•Databases - MS SQL/Oracle/Teradata

•Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data.

•Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

•Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

•A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

•Excellent communication abilities in English communication skill, in written and oral.

•Roles & Responsibilities - [Data analysis] Define and specify data analysis target and support modeling / verification / test / application.

•[Data-based decision making] Research and support the insight to support decision making in the areas of business direction/market strategy/product strategy.

•[Verification of decision effects] Support methods to verify the effect of decision on business.

•[Algorithms acidization] Support implementing, evaluating and verifying algorithms for data analysis.

•Excellent communication skills

•Continuous learning attitude

•Team worker

•Meticulous Education bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or related technical skills.




Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

HTML:
About TCS:


Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.


Skills and Responsibilities:

• Good years of experience in Data Analyst/Data Engineer.

•Experience in data visualization, data cleaning, data manipulation (extract, transform, load), and tool usage of Tableau, Talend, SSIS.

•Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

•Databases - MS SQL/Oracle/Teradata

•Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data.

•Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

•Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

•A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

•Excellent communication abilities in English communication skill, in written and oral.

•Roles & Responsibilities - [Data analysis] Define and specify data analysis target and support modeling / verification / test / application.

•[Data-based decision making] Research and support the insight to support decision making in the areas of business direction/market strategy/product strategy.

•[Verification of decision effects] Support methods to verify the effect of decision on business.

•[Algorithms acidization] Support implementing, evaluating and verifying algorithms for data analysis.

•Excellent communication skills

•Continuous learning attitude

•Team worker

•Meticulous Education bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or related technical skills.


Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Hybrid 3 days a week

Description

The person will be on the new Operational & Business Metrics team within an IT Management/COO organization. The team defines and produces metrics focusing on key initiatives in our space, operational effectiveness and business management. The team works horizontally across many silos. The person will be in a business & data analytics role, working on a team of three (or four depending when they join).




Responsibilities:

Display strong analytical skills, with a proven track record of managing & reporting on large datasets.
You will engage in the entire data life cycle - collect requirements, identify or build data source, analyze data, build data pipelines to load and transform data, visualize and present data.
Ensure data quality, manage and scale data solutions.
Implementing appropriate industry-standard practices, including defining and reporting on key metrics, identifying risks, issues, gaps, and dependencies within and across work streams.
Assistance with documenting data models and flows, artifacts, and responsibilities.
Develop, analyze, and present findings in response to senior management requests.
Demonstrate good time management and ability to prioritize tasks and to meet deadlines across multiple projects.
Must be flexible, highly adaptable to a constantly changing environment. The candidate will be asked to juggle multiple ad hoc requests in addition to the BAU aspects of the role.

The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated and flexible team player who has a strategic vision but also the ability to execute successfully.




Requirements:

Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience working with data analytics / visualization software. Power BI preferred.
Background in statistics or data science is a plus.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills (Verbal and Written).
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to analyze / synthesize large amounts of information and present findings to senior audiences.
Ability to work across functional disciplines and with all levels of the organization.
Ability to work independently in a high-pressure environment while juggling multiple tasks.
Ability to be flexible with ever-changing prioritization.
Creative thinker who will take complete ownership and accountability.
Background in statistics or data science is a plus.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Vention helps some of the most innovative manufacturing companies automate their production floor in just a few days. Vention's online-first manufacturing automation platform (MAP) enables its clients to design, automate, order, and deploy manufacturing equipment directly from their web browser.

Vention is headquartered in Montreal, Canada, with offices in Berlin and Boston, and is used in over 3,000 factories on 5 continents. As one of Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and Great Place to Work, we are a performance driven culture that cares deeply about happiness. We like ambitious goals, facts & data, and constructive debates. But at the same time, we know that we can’t repeatedly push ourselves if we are not surrounded by an uplifting and caring work environment. Those two sides of our culture, feed each other and are safeguarded with the same level of attention. Our values & principles include:


We make our clients successful - we do what’s right for our customers, even when it makes our roles more challenging.
We execute and deliver - we set ambitious goals for ourselves and are energized about meeting them.
We debate, then commit - we challenge our own perspectives and ideas in pursuit of the best solutions.
We innovate to inspire - we value innovation in products, user experiences, and business practices.
We collaborate to achieve more - we work as one team to achieve more than we would on our own.
We empower our people to reach their full potential - we hold ourselves to high standards but know when to celebrate progress & achievements


Job Description

Reporting to the Director of Analytics, the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the integrity of BI solutions that are crucial in supporting data analysis and reporting. An important part of the BI Analyst’s role will also be to perform complex data analysis leveraging BI tools and visualizations to uncover actionable insights that help drive business decisions.

If you are passionate about implementing robust and scalable BI solutions, leveraging data to derive actionable business insights and being at the forefront of influencing operational decision making, then this is the opportunity for you.

Roles And Responsibilities

Data Analysis Mastery


Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards that provide stakeholders with actionable insights to drive business decisions.
Conduct thorough data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth and business optimization.
Assist in developing statistical and predictive analytics models enhancing business performance (e.g. predict consumer behavior, marketing attribution, customer lifetime value, sales forecasts, etc.).


Robust BI Development


Develop and implement scalable BI solutions using tools such as Power BI and Looker.
Design and maintain ETL processes and data models to ensure efficient data flow and integrity.


Data Quality Assurance


Implement rigorous data quality checks and validation processes to uphold data integrity.
Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies to ensure accurate reporting and analysis.
Document existing reports, their purposes, and monitor stakeholder utilization to limit report redundancy.


Strategic Stakeholder Engagement


Serve as a trusted advisor to business stakeholders, translating complex data analyses into actionable recommendations.
Collaborate effectively across teams to understand business needs and deliver tailored BI solutions.


Qualifications


2+ years of relevant hands-on work experience as BI Analyst/Developer, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or related field performing data analysis, creating complex data models and gaining a strong understanding of BI solutions.
A degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or other relevant field; Master’s degree an asset.
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Excel for data manipulation, querying and data analysis.
Expert in using BI tools such as Power BI, Looker or Tableau to create insightful visualizations.
Demonstrated ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data modelling techniques (i.e. Snowflake, Airbyte, AWS (S3, Redshift, Glue, Appflow)).
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills with the ability to communicate complex concepts to cross functional stakeholders; Bilingual (English/French) a strong asset.
Ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial, dynamic, and fast-paced environment.


Additional Information

How We Take Care of You


Flexible paid time off and remote work policies
Complimentary beverages and snacks so that you are fueled and ready for your day
Global comprehensive health plans so you feel your best
Career growth opportunities. Your future matters.
Fun-filled social events curated based on diverse interests for our team to celebrate together. From sponsored sports teams to trivia nights
Time off to volunteer and give back to your community.


What To Expect In Your Interview


Initial Call
Meet the Team
Challenge
Decision & Offer


‍Commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity

Our culture is an uplifting environment for high achievers. The fast-paced, high-performance environment will give you the opportunity to build products, processes and strategies that will have a lasting impact.

When you join Vention, you join a team of professionals with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives. Together, we strive to nurture a supportive and inclusive work environment for all. We push each other to achieve extraordinary results and forge long term relationships as a result of the intensity and passion.

We’re passionate about helping you do your best work. Claim your seat and find out what you can do!

If you're unsure if your experience perfectly matches our job posting, we encourage you to apply anyway! We are happy to chat and get to know you better while you can understand the role as well.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2013, Organigram first began as a medical cannabis provider. Today, the Company is focused on winning in the Canadian recreational market and dynamically expanding the company’s global footprint and influence.

Organigram has developed a portfolio of adult-use recreational cannabis brands including Edison, Big Bag o’ Buds, SHRED, Monjour, Holy Mountain and Trailblazer. Quebec’s top-selling hash brand Tremblant Cannabis, and artisanal craft brand, Laurentian are also additions to Organigram’s brand portfolio. Organigram operates facilities in three provinces across the country. The primary indoor growing facility is in Moncton, New Brunswick, the premium hash production and premium cultivation facility is in Lac-Supérieur, Quebec and there is a highly automated facility dedicated to edibles manufacturing in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The Company is regulated by Health Canada under the Cannabis Act (Canada) and the Cannabis Regulations (Canada).

Organigram is focused on translating operational excellence into strong financial results and return on investment for shareholders.

Job Summary

As a Commercial Analyst based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making processes. You’ll collaborate closely with the Commercial and IT teams to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights that optimize our recreational cannabis commercial strategies. Your work will directly inform sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain decisions, helping to drive growth and efficiency across the company.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, is eager to develop their skills in a dynamic environment and is excited about making a tangible impact on one of Canada’s leading licensed producer.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze commercial performance data to support decision-making across sales, marketing, commercialization and supply chain teams.
Develop and enhance Power BI dashboards and other analytical tools, transforming data into clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, maintain, and transform data from multiple internal and external sources for analysis.
Create and maintain data models to ensure accurate reporting and forecasting.
Translate business questions into analytical projects and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and solve specific business challenges.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all analysis and reporting.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve data analytics processes and tools in collaboration with IT and business teams.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Role: Data Analyst - Teradata

Location: Canada Remote

FULLTIME


Proficient in writing and debugging Complex SQL's queries & Stored procedure in Teradata.
Work with business teams and cross-functional partners to determine true reporting need, align on report, and tool outputs.
Very good knowledge in Data warehousing concepts
Analyze and develop strategies and approaches to import and transfer data between source, staging, and ODS/Data Warehouse destinations.
Hands-on experience in any of the ETL tools like SSIS, Informatica.
Good Communication skill and ability to elicit requirement from business users.
Worked in Agile environment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid 1-3x/week on site)
Contract Duration: 08 months (with possible extension)
Schedule Hours: 9 am-5 pm Monday-Friday (No OT)
 
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst and/ or Data Analyst focusing on technical projects.
2 years of experience working with data analysis techniques and tools, such as SQL, Excel, PowerBI and Tableau.
Demonstrated knowledge of one or more key information service standards such as SDLC, ITIL, Six Sigma, etc.
Experience with requirements management tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile, Scrum (preferably) or Waterfall.
Nice-To-Have Skills:
Experience in Google Cloud Platform
Bilingual: English and Spanish
Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis ) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.
Typical Day in Role:
Analyzes performance of process activities, identifies problem areas, and presents findings in clear, concise charts, graphs, tables, or summaries.
Work with key stakeholders and gather requirements.
Establishes standardized methods of recording, tracking and reporting on activity.
Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes.
Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
Best vs. Average Candidate:
The best candidate is someone with experience as BA and DA, speaks Spanish, and has a certificate in IIBA.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or a related field required
Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.

  • Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis ) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.
Typical Day in Role:
  • Analyzes performance of process activities, identifies problem areas, and presents findings in clear, concise charts, graphs, tables, or summaries.
  • Work with key stakeholders and gather requirements.
  • Establishes standardized methods of recording, tracking and reporting on activity.
  • Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes.
  • Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
Best vs. Average Candidate:
  • The best candidate is someone with experience as BA and DA, speaks Spanish, and has a certificate in IIBA.
Education:
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or a related field required
  • Any process certification, such as Six Sigma, IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis) CBPP, BPM, ISO 20000, ITIL, CMMI.
#MON

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Figment is the world’s leading provider of blockchain infrastructure. We provide the most comprehensive staking solution for our over 500+ institutional clients including exchanges, wallets, foundations, custodians, and large token holders to earn rewards on their crypto assets. These clients rely on Figment’s institutional staking service including rewards optimization, rapid API development, rewards reporting, partner integrations, governance, and slashing protection. Figment is backed by industry experts, financial institutions and our global team across twenty three countries. This all leads to our mission to support the adoption, growth and long term success of the Web3 ecosystem.




We are a growth stage technology company – looking for people who are builders and doers. People who are comfortable plotting their course through ambiguity and uncertainty to drive impact and who are excited to work in new ways and empower a generative company culture.




About the Role

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Data Science and Analytics team at Figment. This role is integral to our mission of harnessing data to drive informed decision-making and optimize our business processes. The Senior Data Analyst will work closely with data scientists and other business units to analyze data, create reports, and deliver insights that directly impact our strategy and operations.




We're looking for someone with strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a dynamic environment, dealing with uncertainty, and collaborating across multiple projects.




What you will be doing

Data reporting and pipelining: Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting pipelines. Query databases and process data to support decision-making.
Data Analysis and Visualization: Extract key insights and create visualizations to tell compelling data stories using our tools.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with internal teams like Engineering, Product, Finance, and Customer Success to deliver tailored data solutions.
Understanding Business Needs: Engage with stakeholders to understand Figment's business needs and deliver solutions that elevate Figments operations
Technical Skills: Writing clean, reliable code in the development of scalable solutions.




What you will bring to the team

Analytical Expertise: Strong skills in data analysis and visualization.
Data Tools: DBT, Snowflake Fivetran, AWS, and Monte Carlo.
Technical Skills: Proven experience with SQL, GitHub, Sigma (or equivalent)
Domain expertise: Familiarity of working with Blockchains or in the Web3 space (nice to have)
Communication Skills: Strong ability to convey complex insights clearly and concisely to various stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: Ensure accuracy and reliability in data reporting and analysis.
Adaptability: Thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapting to new challenges as they arise.




This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and eager to make a meaningful impact at Figment. If you thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment and have a knack for turning data into actionable insights, we would love to hear from you.




One of Figment’s core principles is “Making the Invisible Visible” - ensuring transparency and information sharing in all communication. Figment is committed to transparency regarding pay, benefits, and other compensation types for all internal roles as well as all roles being hired for.




Base Salary: The CAD base salary range for this position is CAD $115,000 - $145,000. The US base salary range for this position is USD $115,000 - $145,000. This range reflects base salary only, and does not include additional compensation or benefits. For candidates in other countries, the pay range will be disclosed upon your first interview with Figment (being a globally remote company, the list of salary ranges would simply be too long to note here!). The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum range for a new hire across all Canada or the US. A candidate’s specific pay within the range will be determined by various factors including job-related skills, relevant education, and training.




Benefits: All employees of Figment receive the following competitive benefits. For candidates beyond Canada and the US, benefits will be outlined during your first interview with Figment.

100% remote-first environment, with co-working spaces in our employee “hubs” across the globe for those who enjoy a hybrid model
4 weeks of PTO that kick in day one, with an additional 1 week of flex days
Extended company-paid health benefits that kick in day one
Best in class parental leave and flexible arrangements
A home office stipend to create a space that you enjoy working in
Monthly Wifi reimbursement
A yearly Learning & Development budget
401K (US) or RRSP match (Canada)
Stock Options in the company
Competitive bonus (based on company performance) that is distributed bi-annually - we believe that the company’s success should be shared with our employees often
For roles listed within the Sales Department, there is instead a competitive commissions structure which will be outlined during your first interview with Figment
Annual onsite company gatherings and retreats to inspire team bonding, collaboration, and fun!
A culture of honesty, professionalism and risk taking in a high-growth environment
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Angular Directions are working closely with a unique company based out of Canada who are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to drive their operation in Ottawa. With a dedication to Ecomm Optimisation, Risk Management, and Data Analysis, this company is a proud client of ours and we're delighted to help them find the ideal BI Analyst with strong foundations in SQL and Tableau and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. Join their dynamic team and help them drive business intelligence initiatives forward.




We are opening our new office in Ottawa in the coming weeks and so any successful applicant will be working 3 or 4 days per week on-site in Ottawa.




We have created an overview of the role and the needs for the role below:




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and analyze data from various sources.
Design, build, and deploy Tableau reports and dashboards to provide insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with multiple stakeholder groups to understand their business requirements
Support the continuous improvement of data quality and reporting processes.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Tableau for data visualization and dashboard creation and wider Tableau proficiency, as well as SQL knowledge.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Previously worked with agile project management tools eg. Jira , Trello would be a bonus.
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.







What We Offer:

Competitive salary and paid health insurance.
RRSP group benefits savings plan
Hybrid work schedule
Training and tuition reimbursement
New equipment / handwear with up-to-date applications
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Allowance for monthly commute/ parking
Team building activities
A collaborative and innovative work environment.




We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is looking for a Data Analyst in Vancouver or Toronto to join our growing team! Working cross-functionally with the Marketing, Technology and Operations teams, you will support the team with various reporting needs.

We are looking for someone with strong reporting and analytical skills who can support decision-making by offering strong insights from new and existing data sources. WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is an exciting, fast-growing House detailing franchise, part of O2E Brands, the parent company of the hugely successful 1-800-GOT-JUNK?

When we say It’s All About People, we mean it. We have created a hybrid work model that helps us get together to Collaborate, Celebrate and Connect while enjoying the flexibility of working where it makes sense for you. For this role’s duty and responsibility, we anticipate that you will be in the office 25% of the time.

Day in the Life


Cross Functional Collaboration: Engage with all areas of the brand, including marketing, finance, sales center, and operations, to organize, analyze and report on data across departments. Liaise with technology teams to help support business initiatives, adding clarity to technology requirements and communicating priority related to support requirements for data.Collaborate and coordinate data request processes to ensure requested audiences, segmentations, and exclusions are clearly defined and understood.
Reporting: Design, develop, maintain and optimize reports and dashboards. Create ad hoc reports measuring the performance of strategic initiatives. These initiatives may include projects within our digital roadmap, marketing campaigns and customer journey funnels.
Analysis: Provide fact-based, data-driven insights and analysis to formulate meaningful conclusions and recommendations. Identify trends in the data and proactively concisely communicate them. Develop KPI measures to track achievement. Build, test, and run SQL queries to deliver data extracts for analysis needs. Build or edit data views in the data warehouse.
Data Governance: Identify and support standardization of key performance indicators to measure and support new and existing business initiatives. Support standardization of Goal tracking and input tools (Google Sheets) among business units. Partner with data stewards and data owners by monitoring and drawing attention to real or potential data quality issues.". Partner with the data warehouse manager to ensure customer records in both marketing automation platforms and POS (Salesforce) are cleansed and that segmentation is intact
Technology: Tableau Online server, user and content management. Supporting Data Flows, identifying and resolving errors in daily updates for key sources. Salesforce report development (not administration). Explore data at the source (warehouse) to validate and inform data engineering requests.


What You Bring To The Table


Proficiency in SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau and Power BI. Tableau certification preferred.
Detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects


Compensation & Benefits


Salary is $ $53,000 to $66,000 (The actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience, and internal parity).
The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health and dental. Focus on your development through our professional development programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness initiatives, including access to gym facilities at our corporate head office. Please speak to us to learn more about what we offer.


About Us

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 15 times!? Take a sneak peek into why that is, here: (YouTube) Check us out on social! At O2E Brands, we know that great talent comes in many forms, and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Core Experience
Description:
TextNow is looking for an experienced Staff Data Analyst to fuel the next stage of our growth. This person will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver analytics & insights that helpbuild and deliver an awesome, high quality and intuitive consumer app and communications platform that enables and excites our customers to connect with anyone, without the barriers of cost or complexity.

What You’ll Do


Be a strong partner to cross-functional teams in understanding the extent and severity our users’ pain points, especially through quantitative methods & approaches.
Provide cross-functional teams visibility into key business KPIs and metrics by developing and presenting reports and dashboards.
Independently conduct analyses using rigorous analytic methods and build recommendations that drive decision making and business prioritization
Execute upon experimentation roadmaps by implementing experiments and tests, monitoringresults and presenting recommendations
Generate and share actionable insights with Director+ level leadership via written artifacts such as decks and memos, and verbally in forums such as weekly standup meetings.


Who You Are


BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred.
8+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
Hands-on experience in designing, building, operating, and maintaining Tableau dashboards
Knowledge of consumer app businesses and familiarity with concepts such as NPS is preferred.
Experience in experimentation (A/B tests, geo tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g hypothesis testing) required.
Knowledge of commonly used analytic methods such as regression, decision trees and forecasting is highly preferred.
Experience in and ability to play “trusted advisor” to senior and executive leadership and help make change happen. Fast learner.
Being a fast learner also means the ability to admit defeat, ask for help and iterate quickly so you can learn from your mistakes and move ahead.
Respectfully candid with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders as well as peers on the data team
Resourceful and scrappy with the ability to deliver insights to the right teams in a timely manner.
Show more

Who You Are

  • BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred.
  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
